mask_imposer.imposer.mask_image module

class mask_imposer.imposer.mask_image.MaskImage(mask_set: mask_imposer.definitions.namedtuples.MaskSet)

Bases: landmarks_predictor.image.Image

resized(width: int, height: int, show: bool = False) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.typing._generic_alias.ScalarType]], mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.PointerMap]

We measure distance between opposite points left/right and top/bottom on mask and target image and scale mask to make this distances equal.

scale_to(landmarks_dictionary: Dict[int, Tuple[int, int]]) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.typing._generic_alias.ScalarType]], mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.PointerMap]

Computes distances to which mask image should be resized and resizes it.

Accordingly to detected landmarks.

mask_imposer.imposer.mask_imposer module

class mask_imposer.imposer.mask_imposer.Imposer(output: Optional[mask_imposer.definitions.namedtuples.Output], mask_set: mask_imposer.definitions.namedtuples.MaskSet, improvements: mask_imposer.definitions.namedtuples.Improvements, logger: logging.Logger)

Bases: object

Class overlay mask image on front face according to detected landmarks.

impose(landmarks_collection: Dict[str, Dict[int, Tuple[int, int]]], fake_map: Optional[Dict[str, Tuple[int, int]]]) → Union[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[Any]], List[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[Any]]]]

Imposes mask image on images stored as a dictionary keys in landmarks detections.

save(filename: str, image: landmarks_predictor.image.Image) → None

Save image with filename in output_format.

Switches mask image.

Coordinates x,y wrapper*.

class mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.PointerMap(input_points: Optional[Union[Dict[int, mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.Pointer], str]] = None)

Bases: object

Mapping pointers to characteristic mask points.

get_bottom_index() → int

Index of bottom point.

get_bottom_point() → mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.Pointer

Bottom point is the lowest point chin.

More details available in readme.

get_included_indexes() → List[int]

List of used landmarks indexes (according to readme landmarks scheme).

get_left_index() → int

Index of left point.

get_left_offset() → int

Distance from left image limit to the closest to the left point.

get_left_point() → mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.Pointer

Left point is a one of point from left jaw.

More details available in readme.

get_right_index() → int

Index of right point.

get_right_point() → mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.Pointer

Right point is a one of point from right jaw.

More details available in readme.

get_top_index() → int

Index of top point.

get_top_offset() → int

Distance from top image limit to highest (top) point.

get_top_point() → mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.Pointer

Top point is any point from middle of nose.

More details available in readme.

new_scaled_map(x_scale: Union[int, float], y_scale: Union[int, float])

Builds a new map scaled to given scales.

updated_points(x_scale: Union[int, float], y_scale: Union[int, float]) → Dict[int, mask_imposer.imposer.mask_pointers.Pointer]

Scales all points by appropriate scales.

:returns

a new map of points (does not affect object values)
